Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Bioactive Glass and Allograft for Benign Bone Lesions in Children

Trial_Design.evidence: This pragmatic multicenter randomised controlled trial

Participants.evidence: children aged 4 to 16 years. The study was conducted in four university hospitals in a Scandinavian country.

Intervention.evidence: compared cyst recurrence after intralesional curettage and filling with allograft versus bioactive glass

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the volume of recurrent cyst at 2-year follow-up.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using sealed envelopes, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not possible due to the distinct imaging characteristics of the materials.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 51 were randomised between October 2012 and February 2019

Number_Analysed.evidence: 12 (46%) in the allograft group and 10 (40%) in the bioactive glass group developed a recurrence

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported.

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial was registered at ClinicalTrials.gov (NCT04737590)

Funding.evidence: funded by foundations and national state research funding.
